data.title: LCCC Commencement Ceremony Recognizes Graduates
data.text:
Schnecksville, Pa., June 27, 2024 – Lehigh Carbon Community College held its 57th annual Commencement ceremony on Wednesday, May 15, at the PPL Center in downtown Allentown. Commencement recognized the nearly 950 students who have earned associate degrees, certificates or diplomas from December 2023, May 2024 and anticipated for August 2024.

LCCC president Dr. Ann D. Bieber presided over the ceremonies. Chair of the LCCC Board of Trustees David L. Krause offered the welcome.

Elliott Centeno was selected as this year’s student speaker. Centeno, of Northampton, received his associate in arts degree cum laude in Psychology. He will enter Bucknell University in the fall to pursue his bachelor’s degree. At 46, Centeno entered LCCC with the desire to turn his life around and demonstrated the power of an education.

The Students of the Year, selected annually by the LCCC Faculty Association, were announced during the ceremony. Margaret Rodriguez Sanchez, of Allentown, earned her associate in science degree in Psychology. She plans to pursue her bachelor’s degree from Bucknell University. The Early College Student of the Year is Diana Moussa, who earned her associate in arts degree in Business Administration (anticipated August 2024) and also earned her high school diploma from William Allen High School. She plans to transfer to Penn State Lehigh Valley in the fall to pursue her bachelor’s degree in business.

Class of 2024 graduate Mia E. Francisco, who received her associate in arts degree, sang the national anthem and the LCCC alma mater.

Dr. Melanie Turrano, professor of English and president of the LCCC Faculty Association, served as grand marshal for the ceremonies, assisted by faculty members Laura Doherty, Lacey L. Gonzalez, Kaitlyn Herling, Andrew King and Michelle L. Mitchell.

Larissa Verta, vice president of academic services and student development, presented the candidates for graduation.

The following individuals received academic awards:

2024 All-Pennsylvania Academic Team – Marie Victoire Alexis and Haily Hottenstein

2024 New Century Transfer Pathway Scholar – Marie Victoire Alexis

2024 Gold Scholar on Coca Cola’s Academic Team – Haily Hottenstein

2024 All-USA Academic Team – Marie Victoire Alexis

Student Government Association Commencement Speaker Award – Elliott Centeno

Student Government Association Commencement Soloist Award – Mia E. Francisco

Climax Goulder Bealine Award (Business Management) – Wendy Weaver

Computer Science Faculty Recognition Awards – Nathaniel Zellner (A.S. degree) and Cullin Hawk (A.A.S. degree)

Philip Fahy Memorial Award (Criminal Justice) – Bailey Witt

Martin Byrer Mathematics Achievement Award – Brianna Schneberger

Rosemary Kradel Mathematics Achievement Award – Braydon Smith

Lehigh County Chapter of American Association of Medical Assistants Award – Hollie E. Pellow

Lehigh County Medical Society Award (Medical Assistant) – Ashley Gearheart and Seuli Das

Associate Degree in Nursing, Faculty Recognition Award – Alicia Marie Smith

Student Nurses Association of Pennsylvania (SNAP) – LCCC Chapter Service Award – Adriana Marie Berdecia-Colon

Wayne E. Kirker Award (Physical Therapist Assistant) – Jacob Wooden

Gilbert A. Scheetz Scholastic Achievement Award (Physical Therapist Assistant) – Ryan Kelly

Professor William L.F. and Mrs. Mary Joan Schmehl Political Science Organization Alumni Award – Andi Hoherchak

Distinction in Psychology Award – Salma Meguid

Distinction in Science Award – Emma Mae Miller

Professor Elizabeth (Bette) Hummer Memorial Award (adult student in Social Science) – Amanda Porreca

Teacher Education Student Association Scholarship Award – Rylee Ann Wenzel

Country Doctor Veterinary Hospital Award (Veterinary Technician) – Deven Guthrie

Jennifer L. Snyder Memorial Veterinary Technician Scholarship – Amanda Colecio, Kristen Lengel, Alexis Gehring, Olivia Grube

Wright Veterinary Medical Center Veterinary Technician Award – Kailah Altemose and Michaela Buchwalter
